result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan C Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Property Other Than Building [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.03.
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure  to pay will result in a civl judgment:  Restitution of $1,750.00 payable to Kristine L. first priority; restitution to Carmen F. set at zero.  All court costs, fees and surcharges including any domestic violence surcharges that apply.
All Court costs, surcharges and/or restitution to be paid from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.  Credit for 171 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with Kristine L. unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved modification (this is also a condition of Initial Confinement).
No contact with Carmen F. or the residence loacated at 1643 S. 82 Street in West Allis, WI. (this is also a condition of Initial Confinement)
If defendant is adjudicated  the father, the Court will allow for a No Violent Contact Order with the defendant's children.
No possession of a firearm.

Cooperate with any Family Court order and follow through with any Family Court orders.
Participate in any recommended counseling and or treatment.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan C Ortiz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (39 pages) commencing AUGUST 11, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Juan C Ortiz in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Juan C Ortiz in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.   
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Carolyn A.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  40 MONTHS with 171 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 16 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24MONTHS.


As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 52 MONTHS with 171 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 16 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-No contact with Kristine L. UNLESS the victim request contact, and then only after the agent has approved modification (this is also a condition of initial confinement).
-No contact with Carmen F. or the residence located  at1643 S. 82nd Street in West Allis, Wisconsin (this is also a condition of initial confinement).
-If the defendant is the adjudicated father, the Court will allow for a No Violent Contact Order with the defendant's children.
-Cooperate with any family court order, and follow through with any family court orders.
-Participate in any recommended counseling and or treatment.
-No possession of a firearm.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1,750.00 payable to Kristine L. (first priority). Court set restitution for Carmen F. at $0.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including any domestic violence surcharges that apply); 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment..

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Juan C Ortiz in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Juan C Ortiz in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. Case previously spun to Branch 15, Judge Watts. Branch 15 unable to hear this matter, case returned to branch 23. For reasons stated on the record, the court adjourned case to branch 36 for Sentencing.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 23 in trial, case spun to Judge Watts, Br. 15.

Defendant Juan C Ortiz in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 3 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Juan C Ortiz not in court, in custody.  Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains set for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23 on 5/15/2015 at 8:30 AM.
Case set for Bail/Bond Hearing at request of Defense, State did not object. Case set for 4/13/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Motion for Reeducation of Bail.

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Juan C Ortiz not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

AS TO COUNT 3
On motion of the Court, Court ordered charge amended to 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.30(2), a Class G Felony.

Defendant Juan C Ortiz in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Juan C Ortiz in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Detective Jason Vanderwerff. State requests exhibit moved into evidence. Defense objects. Court allowed referenced sworn statements in the criminal complaint admissible. Exhibit 1 moved into evidence. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Exhibit 1 withdrawn. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Christine L. or her children; Scott L; David L; Cyle N; Carmen F; AW(dob:11-17-1996); DW(dob:2-6-2000); SS (dob: 12/7/2001)
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Juan C Ortiz in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Juan C Ortiz in custody.  
David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
IF RELEASED DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
